about_the_game:
"STARS COMMANDER" is a game set in space and focused on trade
of material resources between spaceships and space stations.
Here are the main features of this game:
All the resources that can be managed are always valued at the same price
of reference, equal to the purchase and sale and specific for each resource.
In the game economy, profit is made on the transportation of resources
from one station to another and is a compensation linked to the quantity delivered,
so it doesn't matter looking for the best buyer or the best seller
but it is sufficient that there is a request, or availability,
of resources compatible with your spaceship.
Stations and spaceships can be purchased as additional possessions
of the player's possessions.
Spaceships are not controlled with manual commands but are controlled, even remotely,
giving destination orders to the autopilot.
When the spaceship is docked at a station you can enter it
playing in first person.
In each station there is an access to the station computer to manage
resource exchange operations.
Additionally, some stations will give you the ability to dock "trailers."
Trailers are similar to spaceships but have no engine or crew
and can only be used for the transport of goods;
for their management a particular spaceship is used which carries out
the "tractor" function.

The aim of the game is to be able to increase your economic gain,
trying to buy stations and spaceships, and keeping active
station trade.
The difficulty of the game is due to poor resource production
in the stations because they were poorly supplied, or because they lacked crew,
this affects your financial situation due to costs
that you will have to bear.
As an option, to lower the difficulty of the game, in each station
you have the possibility to find some cash prizes(in the fiction of the game)
hidden in some cupboards.

Once you have accumulated a certain amount of money you will be able to purchase
spaceships and trailers with different characteristics,
choosing those most suitable for the transport you intend to carry out
and reach hundreds of destinations in the game's universe.
detailed_description:
"STARS COMMANDER" is a game set in space and focused on trade
of material resources between spaceships and space stations.
Here are the main features of this game:
All the resources that can be managed are always valued at the same price
of reference, equal to the purchase and sale and specific for each resource.
In the game economy, profit is made on the transportation of resources
from one station to another and is a compensation linked to the quantity delivered,
so it doesn't matter looking for the best buyer or the best seller
but it is sufficient that there is a request, or availability,
of resources compatible with your spaceship.
Stations and spaceships can be purchased as additional possessions
of the player's possessions.
Spaceships are not controlled with manual commands but are controlled, even remotely,
giving destination orders to the autopilot.
When the spaceship is docked at a station you can enter it
playing in first person.
In each station there is an access to the station computer to manage
resource exchange operations.
Additionally, some stations will give you the ability to dock "trailers."
Trailers are similar to spaceships but have no engine or crew
and can only be used for the transport of goods;
for their management a particular spaceship is used which carries out
the "tractor" function.

The aim of the game is to be able to increase your economic gain,
trying to buy stations and spaceships, and keeping active
station trade.
The difficulty of the game is due to poor resource production
in the stations because they were poorly supplied, or because they lacked crew,
this affects your financial situation due to costs
that you will have to bear.
As an option, to lower the difficulty of the game, in each station
you have the possibility to find some cash prizes(in the fiction of the game)
hidden in some cupboards.

Once you have accumulated a certain amount of money you will be able to purchase
spaceships and trailers with different characteristics,
choosing those most suitable for the transport you intend to carry out
and reach hundreds of destinations in the game's universe.
name: STARS COMMANDER

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: WINDOWS 10 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5, 3.0 GHz, 7th generation
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated Memory: 1 GB; Feature Levels: 11_0
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1260 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: The game uses the resolution of your desktop in full screen or windowed mode automatically. The game has been tested up to a maximum desktop resolution of 1920x1080 (however this is not a limit). The application does not recognize the use of multiple simultaneous monitors. Use a 16:9 resolution monitor.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: This is a game set in space and focused on trade of resources between spaceships and space stations.
